metadata.subject: Market Value Appraisal - IGY American Yacht Harbor Marina
metadata.document_id: IRR - Caribbean File No. 172-2015-0181, Client Reference: 23559
metadata.sender: Integra Realty Resources - Caribbean (Mark J. Weathers, James V. Andrews)

organizations: U.S. House Committee on Oversight and Accountability
U.S. Virgin Islands Department of Planning and Natural Resources

relationships.description: Property owner seeking commercial credit administration through bank
Appraisal firm conducting property valuation for banking client

analysis.purpose: To develop an opinion of market value for commercial credit administration purposes
analysis.significance: Official appraisal of marina property for banking purposes, shows property valuation trends in US Virgin Islands

concerns: Parking garage encroachments on government land
Fuel storage tanks present environmental assumptions

notable_quotes: The subject is an existing 250-slip marina with 5 commercial buildings containing a mixture of retail and office space types.
Based on the valuation analysis in the accompanying report, and subject to the definitions, assumptions, and limiting conditions expressed in the report, our opinion of value is $24,360,000.
The closure of the Hovensa refinery and the failure to facilitate a sale to a buyer who can re-open the facility as a refinery will continue to plague St. Croix until other new developments occur.
red_flags: Property value decreased from 2007 purchase price of $25.5M to $24.36M valuation
Environmental assumptions about fuel storage tanks

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this professional appraisal document

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed or evidenced in this professional appraisal report

public_knowledge.context: Standard commercial real estate appraisal document for banking purposes

analysis.summary: This is a professional real estate appraisal report valuing the IGY American Yacht Harbor Marina in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands at $24,360,000 as of November 2015 for Banco Popular de Puerto Rico. The document provides comprehensive analysis of the marina property, local economy, and competitive market conditions in the US Virgin Islands.
